ygData.subject: Re: Windows Installation cantera.lib
ygData.msgSnippet: It seems that when Win32 Debug is selected as the Active Configuration then the compiler will generate cantera_d.lib.  When I switch it to Win32 Release, then

It seems that when Win32 Debug is selected as the Active 
Configuration then the compiler will generate cantera_d.lib.  When I 
switch it to Win32 Release, then the compiler generates cantera.lib.  
However, I still get this error when I try to run "make win".  In my 
mind, it shouldn't need to remake cantera.lib because that is what 
VisualStudio just generated.  

Anybody have any ideas?

$ make win
/usr/bin/install -c -d build/include/cantera
rm -r -f build/include/cantera/*
/usr/bin/install -c -d build/include/cantera/kernel
/usr/bin/install -c -d build/include/cantera/kernel/oneD
/usr/bin/install -c -d build/include/cantera/kernel/zeroD
/usr/bin/install -c -d build/include/cantera/kernel/converters
/usr/bin/install -c -d build/include/cantera/kernel/transport
/usr/bin/install -c Cantera/cxx/include/*.h build/include/cantera
/usr/bin/install -c config.h build/include/cantera
/usr/bin/install -c Cantera/src/*.h build/include/cantera/kernel
/usr/bin/install -c Cantera/src/oneD/*.h 
build/include/cantera/kernel/oneD
/usr/bin/install -c Cantera/src/zeroD/*.h 
build/include/cantera/kernel/zeroD
/usr/bin/install -c Cantera/src/converters/*.h 
build/include/cantera/kernel/converters
/usr/bin/install -c Cantera/src/transport/*.h 
build/include/cantera/kernel/transport
cd Cantera/python; make win
make[1]: Entering directory `/home/Administrator/cantera-
cvs/Cantera/python'
make[1]: *** No rule to make target 
`C:/cygwin/home/Administrator/cantera/build/lib/i686-pc-win32/ca
ntera.lib', needed by `_winbuild'.  Stop.
make[1]: Leaving directory `/home/Administrator/cantera-
cvs/Cantera/python'
make: *** [python] Error 2









--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "Karl Meredith" <kvm@c...> wrote:
> I poked a little further, and discovered that when I build 'all' in
> VisualStudio, it creates build/lib/i686-pc-win32/cantera_d.lib and 
then when
> I go to do 'make win' from cygwin it is looking for
> build/lib/i686-pc-win32/cantera.lib instead.  Is there a 
discrepency here?
> 
> 
> -----Original Message-----
> From: kvirgilm [mailto:kvm@c...]
> Sent: Tuesday, September 21, 2004 2:40 PM
> To: cantera@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [cantera] Windows Installation cantera.lib
> 
> 
> I am trying to install cantera from the source on windows.  I
> built 'all' in Visual Studio.  Then, I go back to the cantera
> directory and try 'make win'.  This is what I get:
> 
> 
> $ make win
> /usr/bin/install -c -d build/include/cantera
> rm -r -f build/include/cantera/*
> /usr/bin/install -c -d build/include/cantera/kernel
> /usr/bin/install -c -d build/include/cantera/kernel/oneD
> /usr/bin/install -c -d build/include/cantera/kernel/zeroD
> /usr/bin/install -c -d build/include/cantera/kernel/converters
> /usr/bin/install -c -d build/include/cantera/kernel/transport

> /usr/bin/install -c config.h build/include/cantera
> /usr/bin/install -c Cantera/src/*.h build/include/cantera/kernel
> /usr/bin/install -c Cantera/src/oneD/*.h
> build/include/cantera/kernel/oneD
> /usr/bin/install -c Cantera/src/zeroD/*.h
> build/include/cantera/kernel/zeroD
> /usr/bin/install -c Cantera/src/converters/*.h
> build/include/cantera/kernel/converters
> /usr/bin/install -c Cantera/src/transport/*.h
> build/include/cantera/kernel/transport
> cd Cantera/python; make win
> make[1]: Entering directory `/home/Administrator/cantera-
> cvs/Cantera/python'
> make[1]: *** No rule to make target
> `C:/cygwin/home/Administrator/cantera/build/lib/i686-pc-win32/ca
> ntera.lib', needed by `_winbuild'.  Stop.
> make[1]: Leaving directory `/home/Administrator/cantera-
